page.title: 16Visitor's Morwenstow
page.content: A Cornish cross can be found in the grounds of{Tonacombe Manor}and another inscribed at the front entrance to the {Bush Inn.}At{Shop}is a bellbuoy hauled outside a cottage whilst next door is a verse engraved in the glass of the porch by Harry Hambly in 1907. The parish contains 4 graveyards, 3 of them non - conformist. There were 10 churches or chapels, 8 of which were non - conformist but only two of them, and the parish church remain in use. Of 8 mills in the area, none are now working but their remains are still apparent in various stages of decay. Along the coastline many ships have foundered where their remains are to be discovered. The parish probably still has{otters in its secluded waterways and was the last refuge of the now extinct{Large {Blue}butterfly.
